title: [dubsmash] Long String in 'shoutout' Parameter Leading Internal server Error on Popular hastags , Community and User Profile
steps: Record a video in the Dubsmash iOS app and include trending hashtags in the description.
Intercept the 'CreateVideo' API request using Burp Suite and insert a long string in the 'shoutout' parameter.
Upload the video and wait for it to appear in the hashtag search.
Attempt to view all videos under the hashtag; observe the API returns an 'INTERNAL SERVER ERROR'.
vuln_description: A long string in the 'shoutout' parameter of the 'CreateVideo' API causes internal server errors in hashtag, community, and user profile APIs, leading to a denial of service for these features.
reason: The vulnerability requires understanding the interaction between the video creation API and subsequent APIs that display video content, but the attack itself is straightforward once the parameter manipulation is identified.
